pr_title: feat: reload TLS certificate without restarting server

timeline.bodyText: As a general design principle best not to rely on statics as they pollute the global namespace.
timeline.author: purplefox

replies.bodyText: Also you probably don't need a custom executor at all - you can use a Vert.x worker thread for this.
replies.author: purplefox

timeline.author: purplefox

replies.bodyText:
This does not work. (I had this initially.) As explained in the PR description:

It's necessary to recreate rather than simply restart the servers because Vert.x only loads TLS certs at the time that the KeyStoreHelper is created, which is only when servers are created.
replies.author: vcrfxia

replies.bodyText:
I'm referring to Server.start/stop not ServerVerticle.start/stop.
If you do that, it will take care of creating new Http Servers for you, no?
replies.author: purplefox

replies.bodyText: Ah, I understand your suggestion now. We'll still need custom logic to ensure the HTTP servers are restarted with the same ports, in the event that port 0 is specified (as is the case in our tests). It's not clear to me that this is actually simpler.
replies.author: vcrfxia

replies.bodyText:
Here's a commit where I've made your suggested change: vcrfxia@612b215
The new test, TlsTest#shouldReloadCert() fails because the server ports changed during the restart but the client still tries to connect to the old port.
If we're OK with the ports changing on restart, we can update the test to recreate the client after the restart.
replies.author: vcrfxia

replies.bodyText: Discussed offline. The only use case for setting port 0 at the moment is in our tests, so we're not going to worry about preserving ports across restarts. As such, I've moved the restart logic from ServerVerticle to Server as suggested, and updated the test to re-create clients in order to use the most up-to-date port.
replies.author: vcrfxia

timeline.bodyText: As previous comment, seems overcomplex - just stopped and starting the Server should do the trick?
timeline.author: purplefox

replies.bodyText: As above -- I initially misunderstood the suggestion. I've made the switch now.
replies.author: vcrfxia

timeline.message: chore: use Vert.x worker rather than executor service
chore: move logic for restarting server from ServerVerticle to Server
test: client trust store should always be valid
fix: use separate thread for file watcher
test: prevent cert reload test from affecting other TLS tests
test: add logging to debug potential flakiness with shouldReloadCert()
test: update assertion to be more informative on failure

timeline.bodyText: Is there any need to interrupt the thread here? If shutdown() is called from this same thread then you set the shutdown flag which means the run() method will return exit ok.
timeline.author: purplefox

replies.bodyText: I had the redundancy as extra insurance that we wouldn't leak resources (in case something changes with the FileWatcher code and shutdown() is no longer foolproof) but I think that was overkill. I've removed the interrupt() and simplified the Server code as you suggested.
replies.author: vcrfxia

timeline.bodyText: I don't think the startFileWatcher flag is necessary if you don't interrupt the watcher thread (see previous comment). This means you can simplify things and have a simple start/stop method as before and always create a new filewatcher in start().
timeline.author: purplefox
purplefox

timeline.bodyText: You can avoid this if FileWatcher extends Thread
timeline.author: purplefox

replies.bodyText: Ah yes, this is a lot better. Thanks for the suggestion! I thought what I was doing didn't feel right, heh :)
replies.author: vcrfxia

timeline.bodyText: Doesn't need to be synchronized if we don't have a thread member and shutdown is volatile
timeline.author: purplefox

timeline.bodyText: Probably should log at error unless this is expected in normal operation?
timeline.author: purplefox

timeline.bodyText: I think it would be good to test reloading the server more than once - i.e. changing the cert more than once, as there might be a bug in the filewatcher/reloading that only manifests after the reload has been done once.
timeline.author: purplefox

replies.bodyText: The test already reloads the server twice: once with a bad cert, and then again with a good cert. Are you suggesting we should repeat the cycle twice, for a total of four reloads?
replies.author: vcrfxia

replies.bodyText: Ah, if you're already reloading more than once that seems fine :)
replies.author: purplefox

timeline.message: fix: configure cert reload before deploying instances

timeline.bodyText: Hey @purplefox , now that FileWatcher extends Thread, do you think it makes sense to get rid of this shutdown() method and instead call interrupt() to terminate the file watcher? I'm wondering whether it's canonical to have a "clean" shutdown method like this, or if interrupt() is understood to be used for that purpose.
timeline.author: vcrfxia

replies.bodyText: Merging PR for now -- will make this improvement in a follow-up (if we think it'd be an improvement).
